text: What architectural style best suits your system (monolithic, microservices, serverless, distributed)?
help_text: The architectural style determines decomposition, deployment, and operational complexity
example_answer: We will use microservices architecture for scalability and independent team ownership

text: What are the key components/services and their responsibilities?
help_text: Clear component responsibilities enable independent development and deployment
example_answer: Auth Service, User Service, Order Service, Payment Service, Notification Service

text: What are your scalability requirements (users, requests per second, data size)?
help_text: Scalability requirements drive infrastructure and architectural decisions
example_answer: We need to support 1 million concurrent users and 100k requests per second

text: How will you scale each component (horizontal scaling, database sharding, caching)?
help_text: Scaling strategies vary by component and workload characteristics
example_answer: Stateless services scale horizontally with load balancers; databases use read replicas and sharding

text: What is your target availability (uptime SLA)?
help_text: Availability targets impact redundancy and failure recovery strategies

text: How will you handle failures and ensure system resilience?
help_text: Resilience patterns include redundancy, failover, circuit breakers, and graceful degradation
example_answer: We will use active-active redundancy, automated failover, circuit breakers, and health checks

text: What communication patterns will you use (synchronous, asynchronous, event-driven)?
help_text: Communication patterns affect coupling, latency, and complexity
example_answer: We will use REST for synchronous calls and event streams for asynchronous workflows

text: What messaging and event streaming technologies will you use?
help_text: Technology choices impact throughput, latency, and operational complexity
example_answer: We will use Kafka for event streaming and RabbitMQ for task queues

text: What is your data consistency strategy (strong, eventual)?
help_text: Consistency requirements impact distributed transaction complexity
example_answer: We will use eventual consistency for user data with strong consistency for financial transactions

text: How will you manage distributed transactions across services?
help_text: Distributed transaction patterns include sagas, two-phase commits, and eventual consistency
example_answer: We will use the saga pattern with compensating transactions for cross-service workflows

text: What is your security architecture and threat model?
help_text: Security architecture should address authentication, authorization, and protection against identified threats
example_answer: We will use OAuth 2.0 for authentication, role-based access control, and encryption at rest/transit

text: How will you manage secrets, keys, and credentials?
help_text: Secrets management is critical for security and compliance
example_answer: We will use a dedicated secrets management service with rotation and audit logging

text: What is your deployment strategy (monolithic, containerized, serverless)?
help_text: Deployment strategy affects release frequency, rollback capability, and operational complexity
example_answer: We will use containerized microservices with Kubernetes orchestration

text: How will you manage configuration and secrets in different environments?
help_text: Environment management ensures configuration differs appropriately across dev, test, staging, production
example_answer: We will use environment variables and a secrets management service for all environments
